definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: It requires a lot more than just being good at your job.
sentences.chinese: 那就需要在做好自己本職工作以外付出多得多的努力。

sentences.english: Its chief consequence is that they cannot do their job well.
sentences.chinese: 其主要後果是，它們不能做好自己的本職工作。

sentences.english: He is a professional at his job.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個精曉本職工作的人。

sentences.english: Strive for constant improvement and take responsibility for your own performance.
sentences.chinese: 力求上進並對自己的本職工作負責。

sentences.english: Thirdly, to master all the necessary know-how to do one's job well.
sentences.chinese: 第三，掌握所有基本技能，幹好本職工作。

sentences.english: This employee treats his or her regular jobas secondary to some other interest.
sentences.chinese: 這類員工把對其他方面的興趣替代了本職工作。

sentences.english: “This would hedge the exposure that exists in your labor, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “這將對沖你本職工作所存在的虧損風險，”他說。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
service to the public/public welfare undertaking/charity/social facility
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
to work industriously/to get things done
to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
